Infringe.definition: to encroach upon in a way that violates law or the rights of another [the right of the people to keep and bear arms
Infringe.origin: [Medieval Latin infringere , from Latin, to break, crush, from in- in + frangere to break]

in·fring·ing.definition: [Medieval Latin, from Latin, to break, crush, fromin +to break]to encroach upon in a way that violates law or the rights of another [the right of the people to keep and bear arms, shall not be"amend. II"]to violate a holder's rights under (a copyright, patent, trademark, or trade name)
